page.title: 17NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY RIDE
page.content: When I went on the train trip a lot of people waved to me. I went past Redland Tiles and saw the Brambles Kennels and I know who lives there. I saw lots of flowers in fields and at the edges of the track. When we stopped near a lorry we smelt a horrid pong of diesel. When we went across roads everybody in cars or any vehicle all waved to us as we went by. When we stopped at the end of the track, before we were on the way back, we asked a few questions. We asked if our train had a name. The driver said that it is the only train without a name but they were going to call it 'Uncle Bulgaria' when the "Wombles" were popular. ("Wombles" are puppets _ supposedly little animals living on Wimbledon common). On the way back I saw things from a different angle. On the way back people picked flowers.
